name: TopStepX Trading Bot Development Guidelines
description: Comprehensive guidelines for AI assistants working on the TopStepX Trading Bot project

project_overview.purpose: Automated trading bot that receives TradingView webhook signals and executes trades on TopStepX platform
project_overview.architecture: Webhook server receives JSON payloads from TradingView, processes signals, and places orders via TopStepX API
project_overview.deployment: Railway.app with environment variables for configuration

critical_priorities.1: NEVER break the core webhook functionality - webhook server MUST always respond to TradingView signals
critical_priorities.2: NEVER deploy changes that could cause silent order failures - all orders must be properly validated
critical_priorities.3: ALWAYS respect Railway environment variables over hardcoded values
critical_priorities.4: ALWAYS test order placement validation before deploying
critical_priorities.5: NEVER modify core trading logic without comprehensive testing

environment_variables.description: Railway environment variables ALWAYS take precedence over hardcoded values
critical_vars: IGNORE_NON_ENTRY_SIGNALS - Controls trim/close signal processing (default: false)
environment_variables.enforcement: All hardcoded values must be replaced with os.getenv() calls with proper defaults

order_validation.description: Order validation must be conditional based on bracket mode
requirements: Check API response structure and success field
Position Brackets (USE_NATIVE_BRACKETS=false): Trust API response, no complex verification
OCO Brackets (USE_NATIVE_BRACKETS=true): Verify orders exist for bracket management
Log full API request/response for debugging
Send Discord notifications ONLY for verified successful orders

error_handling.description: Comprehensive error handling prevents silent failures
requirements: Log all API responses with full details
Check for explicit error fields in responses
Verify order placement with post-placement checks
Handle network timeouts and API errors gracefully

before_making_changes: 1. Read and understand the current codebase structure
2. Identify all environment variables used in the change
3. Check for existing hardcoded values that should use env vars
5. Consider impact on webhook response times
during_development: 1. Add extensive debug logging for API calls
5. Document any new environment variables needed
before_deployment: 1. Verify all hardcoded values are replaced with env vars
2. Test order placement with real API calls
3. Validate error handling with simulated failures
5. Review all logging output for clarity
after_deployment: 1. Monitor logs for API response patterns
2. Verify orders are actually placing in TopStepX
5. Validate environment variables are being used correctly

silent_failures.description: API returns success but doesn't actually place orders
prevention: Always validate API response structure
Check for order ID in response
Verify order exists in TopStepX after placement
Log full API request/response for debugging

environment_variable_override.description: Hardcoded values override Railway environment variables
prevention: Search codebase for hardcoded numbers
Replace all defaults with os.getenv() calls
Test with different environment variable values
Verify Railway deployment config doesn't override env vars

webhook_timeout.description: Webhook processing takes too long and times out
prevention: Keep webhook processing under 30 seconds
Use async background processing for long operations
Return immediate response to TradingView
Handle errors gracefully without blocking

tp1_partial_close_failures.description: TP1 signals close entire position instead of partial close
prevention: Ensure order verification is conditional based on USE_NATIVE_BRACKETS
Position Brackets: Trust API response, avoid complex verification
OCO Brackets: Verify orders exist for bracket management
Never trigger 'flatten all positions' for successful partial closes
Check that TP1_FRACTION is properly applied to position calculations

order_verification_false_failures.description: Order verification fails for market orders that fill immediately
prevention: Market orders often fill immediately and won't appear in open orders
Order history API may have delays showing newly placed orders
For Position Brackets mode, trust API response if success=true and orderId exists
Only verify orders when necessary for bracket management (OCO mode)
Avoid triggering fallback logic for normal market order behavior

integration_tests: Test order placement with real API
deployment_tests: Verify Railway environment variables are loaded

core_files.webhook_server.py: Main webhook server handling TradingView signals
core_files.trading_bot.py: Core trading logic and TopStepX API integration

key_log_patterns: API returned success but NO order ID!
error_indicators: TP1 partial close failed, flattening all positions
⚠️ ORDER VERIFICATION FAILED: Order ID not found
success_indicators: ✅ Position Brackets mode: Trusting API response
TP1 hit: closing X contracts from Y total position
TopStepX will automatically manage stop/take profit orders

pre_deployment: ✓ All hardcoded values replaced with environment variables
post_deployment: ✓ Monitor logs for API response patterns

silent_order_failures: 1. Check logs for '===== API RESPONSE =====' patterns
2. Look for 'API returned success but NO order ID!' errors
3. Verify TopStepX API hasn't changed response format
environment_variable_issues: 2. Verify os.getenv() calls have correct defaults
3. Look for hardcoded values in deployment configs
4. Test with different environment variable values
webhook_timeouts: 1. Check for long-running operations in signal processing
2. Verify async background processing is working
4. Check for infinite loops or hangs
tp1_partial_close_issues: 1. Check if TP1 signals are being ignored (IGNORE_NON_ENTRY_SIGNALS=false)
2. Verify TP1_FRACTION is correctly applied to position calculations
3. Look for 'TP1 partial close failed, flattening all positions' errors
4. Check if order verification is failing for market orders
5. Verify USE_NATIVE_BRACKETS setting matches verification logic
order_verification_failures: 1. Check if verification is appropriate for bracket mode
2. Position Brackets: Trust API response, avoid complex verification
3. OCO Brackets: Verify orders exist for bracket management
4. Look for '⚠️ ORDER VERIFICATION FAILED' in logs
5. Check if market orders are filling immediately (normal behavior)

bracket_mode_understanding.description: Order verification must be conditional based on bracket mode
key_points: Position Brackets (USE_NATIVE_BRACKETS=false): TopStepX automatically manages stop/take profit orders
OCO Brackets (USE_NATIVE_BRACKETS=true): Manual bracket management requires order verification
Never apply complex verification to Position Brackets mode
Trust API response for Position Brackets if success=true and orderId exists

tp1_partial_close_logic.description: TP1 signals must respect partial close logic without triggering fallbacks
key_points: Never trigger 'flatten all positions' for successful partial closes
Position Brackets automatically adjust remaining brackets

market_order_behavior.description: Market orders have different verification requirements than limit orders
key_points: Market orders often fill immediately and won't appear in open orders
Order history API may have delays showing newly placed orders
This is normal behavior, not a failure

environment_variable_precedence.description: Railway environment variables must always take precedence
key_points: Check all hardcoded values in deployment configs (railway.json, Procfile)
Remove hardcoded --position-size arguments from start commands
Use os.getenv() with proper defaults throughout codebase
Test with different environment variable values to verify precedence

code_quality: Always use type hints for function parameters
Add comprehensive docstrings for complex functions
Add debug logging for critical operations
Handle exceptions gracefully with specific error messages
security: Use environment variables for all configuration
Validate all input data from webhooks
Implement proper error handling to prevent information leakage
performance: Use async operations for API calls
Implement proper caching for frequently accessed data
Monitor memory usage and resource consumption
bracket_mode_handling: Always check USE_NATIVE_BRACKETS before applying verification logic
Position Brackets: Trust API response, minimal verification
OCO Brackets: Verify orders exist for bracket management
Never apply OCO verification logic to Position Brackets mode

contact_and_support.documentation: See README.md and DEPLOYMENT_GUIDE.md for detailed setup instructions
contact_and_support.logs: Check webhook_server.log and trading_bot.log for detailed execution logs
contact_and_support.monitoring: Use Railway dashboard to monitor deployment status and logs
